sentences.en: An idea for a novel began to germinate in her mind.
sentences.cn: 一部小说的构思已经在她的头脑中萌发。

sentences.en: Can thin and hollow seeds germinate?
sentences.cn: 瘦瘪的种子能够发芽 吗 ?

sentences.en: Germinate, is a new atmosphere; Moldy, is a mood.
sentences.cn: 发芽, 是一种新气象; 发霉, 是一种心情.

sentences.en: Heat and moisture will germinate the seeds.
sentences.cn: 温度和水分会使种子发芽.

sentences.en: Hence, barley is dampened, allowed to germinate, and is then dried and stored for subsequent use.
sentences.cn: 因此先将大麦润湿, 促其发芽, 然后将大麦芽干燥贮存备用.

sentences.en: I saw everything about me surge forth and germinate.
sentences.cn: 我看见我周围的万物汹涌向前,欣欣向荣.

sentences.en: Place where seeds germinate & nourish plants.
sentences.cn: 什么是苗床种子萌发 和 幼苗汲取营养之所在.

sentences.en: Seeds need water and warmth to germinate.
sentences.cn: 种子发芽需要水和温度.

sentences.en: She put some beans into water to germinate.
sentences.cn: 她把一些豆子放在水中让它们发芽.

sentences.en: Some seed varieties germinate fast, so check every day or so.
sentences.cn: 有一些种子发芽快，所以差不多每天得察看一下。

sentences.en: The idea of setting up his own company began to germinate in his mind.
sentences.cn: 他萌生了自己开公司的想法。

sentences.en: The spores could not germinate under RH & lt ; 93 % .
sentences.cn: 相对湿度小于 93%,孢子不能萌发.

sentences.en: They germinate and grow without their presence being observed.
sentences.cn: 这三者在神不知鬼不觉的情况下,萌芽茁壮.

sentences.en: Warmth is needed for the seeds to germinate.
sentences.cn: 种子发芽需要适当的温度.

sentences.en: You need cool, moist weather for these plants to germinate.
sentences.cn: 这些植物需要清凉潮湿的天气来萌芽.

trans.tran_cn: 发芽, 发育, 使生长
trans.tran_en: if a seed germinates, or if it is germinated, it begins to grow
